8ba2635b-7e26-4b09-b6d9-abe214ea95bd.name: install headless Chrome
8ba2635b-7e26-4b09-b6d9-abe214ea95bd.description:
Install headless Chrome in EC2 RHEL 7.3 using yum
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/add-repositories.html
https://medium.com/@davidkadlec/installing-google-chrome-on-amazon-linux-ec2-d1cb6aa37f28
https://www.sitepoint.com/headless-chrome-node-js/
8ba2635b-7e26-4b09-b6d9-abe214ea95bd.script:
mkdir ~/tmp
cd ~/tmp
rm -f installChrome.sh
pwd
ls -l
saveTemplate:/home/<%s.systemUser%>/tmp/installChrome.sh
<%s.waitFor%> /home/<%s.systemUser%>/tmp/installChrome.sh
sudo yum repolist all

chmod 770 ~/tmp/installChrome.sh

./installChrome.sh
8ba2635b-7e26-4b09-b6d9-abe214ea95bd.template:
#!/bin/sh
sudo rm -f /etc/yum.repos.d/google-chrome.repo
sudo touch /etc/yum.repos.d/google-chrome.repo
sudo chmod 666 /etc/yum.repos.d/google-chrome.repo

sudo echo -e "[google-chrome]
name=google-chrome
baseurl=http://dl.google.com/linux/chrome/rpm/stable/\$basearch
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://dl-ssl.google.com/linux/linux_signing_key.pub" >> /etc/yum.repos.d/google-chrome.repo

sudo touch /etc/yum.repos.d/centos.repo
sudo chmod 666 /etc/yum.repos.d/centos.repo

sudo echo -e "[CentOS-base]
name=CentOS-6 - Base
mirrorlist=http://mirrorlist.centos.org/?release=6&arch=x86_64&repo=os
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=http://mirror.centos.org/centos/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-6

" >> /etc/yum.repos.d/centos.repo

sudo echo -e "#released updates
[CentOS-updates]
name=CentOS-6 - Updates
mirrorlist=http://mirrorlist.centos.org/?release=6&arch=x86_64&repo=updates
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=http://mirror.centos.org/centos/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-6

" >> /etc/yum.repos.d/centos.repo

sudo echo -e "#additional packages that may be useful
[CentOS-extras]
name=CentOS-6 - Extras
mirrorlist=http://mirrorlist.centos.org/?release=6&arch=x86_64&repo=extras
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=http://mirror.centos.org/centos/RPM-GPG-KEY-CentOS-6
" >> /etc/yum.repos.d/centos.repo

sudo yum install -y google-chrome-stable
sudo chmod 600 /etc/yum.repos.d/google-chrome.repo
sudo chmod 600 /etc/yum.repos.d/centos.repo

sudo yum -y install gnu-free-sans-fonts

google-chrome-stable --version

31602283-d63c-4404-847c-2e05d8750880.template:
#!/bin/bash
return_=0
# set to 0 if found
ls node_modules | grep $1 >/dev/null 2>&1 && { return_=1; }

  fi
echo done

0fd18a0b-3169-4c20-941e-0c2c57034463.name: Hello World Data Store
0fd18a0b-3169-4c20-941e-0c2c57034463.description: Adds simple file based persistence. Creates new json file only if it does not exist.
0fd18a0b-3169-4c20-941e-0c2c57034463.script:
rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

#insert new saveFileName
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%saveFileName%' <%a.projectPath%>/<%c.saveFileName%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

#insert jsonVar
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%jsonVar%' <%c.jsonVar%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

echo -e '\n//<%a.add_inits%>' >> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt 

#insert updated template into currentHtmlInsert
<%s.Replace file line with file%> '<%a.add_inits%>' <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt <%a.serverPathFile%> 

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

echo 'var:dataStoreVar:<%c.jsonVar%>'
echo 'var:dataStoreFile:<%a.projectPath%>/<%c.saveFileName%>'

#Create datastore file if it does not exist
if [ ! -e <%a.projectPath%>/<%c.saveFileName%> ]; then
setPromptCodes:3e 20
   echo '{}' > <%a.projectPath%>/<%c.saveFileName%>;
   echo 'New data store created'
else
   echo 'Existing data store file found'
fi
setPrompt:[SysStack]

4efd3885-e3be-45a8-a5c7-c9629b8023ca.name: Hello World Data Store Get (/helloworldGet)
4efd3885-e3be-45a8-a5c7-c9629b8023ca.description:
Provides a simple service to get jason data from a data store.
Returns a row or all rows. 
Call service with 'id=#' to get all rows. Call with 'id=[id]' to get a specific row.
Eg: 
http://myNode/ezGet&id=#
   This will return all rows
http://myNode/ezGet&id=123
  This will return only row where id=123
4efd3885-e3be-45a8-a5c7-c9629b8023ca.script:
rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

#insert jsonVar
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%jsonVar%' <%p.dataStoreVar%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

#insert service End Point name
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serviceEndPointName%' <%c.serviceEndPointName%>  <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
echo var:ezDataGetServiceEndPointName:<%c.serviceEndPointName%>

#add currentHtmlInsert point to end of template
echo -e '\n<!-- <%a.insertServices%>  -->' >> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt 

#insert updated template into server file
<%s.Replace file line with file%> '<%a.insertServices%>' <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt <%a.serverPathFile%> 

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

146d5e37-e456-42aa-b5cf-92c256e4d42b.name: re/start node
146d5e37-e456-42aa-b5cf-92c256e4d42b.description:
Calls sudo forever start to start the node process.

added to crontab manually:
 sudo crontab -u ec2-user -e
@reboot /home/ec2-user/projects/HelloWorld/restartServer.sh
146d5e37-e456-42aa-b5cf-92c256e4d42b.script:
cd <%a.projectPath%> 

<%s.npmInstall%> forever -g

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serverName%' <%a.nodeFileName%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%projectPath%' <%a.projectPath%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

chmod 770 <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
nohup ./restartServer.sh > restart.log &

ceb7b0da-2c89-46f5-b1c6-08d67eab0cb7.name: FAQ Data Store Get - /faqGet
ceb7b0da-2c89-46f5-b1c6-08d67eab0cb7.description:
Provides a simple service to get jason data from a data store.
Returns a row or all rows. 
Call service with 'id=#' to get all rows. Call with 'id=[id]' to get a specific row.
Eg: 
http://myNode/ezGet&id=#
   This will return all rows
http://myNode/ezGet&id=123
  This will return only row where id=123
ceb7b0da-2c89-46f5-b1c6-08d67eab0cb7.script:

echo var:ezDataGetServiceEndPointName:<%c.serviceEndPointName%>

#add currentHtmlInsert point to end of template
echo -e '\n<!-- <%a.insertServices%>  -->' >> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

c7aa8ede-22dc-4fb3-adc5-444ee8ae5964.name: re/start node
c7aa8ede-22dc-4fb3-adc5-444ee8ae5964.description:
Calls sudo forever start to start the node process.

added to crontab manually:
 sudo crontab -u ec2-user -e
@reboot /home/ec2-user/projects/HelloWorld/restartServer.sh
c7aa8ede-22dc-4fb3-adc5-444ee8ae5964.script:
cd <%a.projectPath%> 

<%s.npmInstall%> forever -g

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serverName%' <%a.nodeFileName%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%projectPath%' <%a.projectPath%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

chmod 770 <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
nohup ./restartServer.sh > restart.log &

c95aec12-2d3a-4da5-96fd-3cda069bce22.name: SimpleHTMLTemplate
c95aec12-2d3a-4da5-96fd-3cda069bce22.script:
#Save service ejs 
rm -f <%s.viewsPath%>/<%p.viewName%>.ejs
saveTemplate:<%s.viewsPath%>/<%p.viewName%>.ejs
<%s.waitFor%> <%s.viewsPath%>/<%p.viewName%>.ejs

#use viewName for custom css & js file names
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%viewName%' <%p.viewName%>  <%s.viewsPath%>/<%p.viewName%>.ejs

echo var:servicePathFileName:<%s.viewsPath%>/<%p.viewName%>.ejs
echo var:insertDocReadyJS:%insertDocReady%

echo var:insertJsSrc:%insertJsSrc%
echo var:insertCSSSrc:%insertCSSSrc%

echo var:customCSSFileNamePath:<%s.staticPath%>/clientCSS/<%p.viewName%>.css
echo var:customJsFileNamePath:<%s.staticPath%>/clientJs/<%p.viewName%>.js

#create blank custom css file
export cssPath=<%s.staticPath%>/clientCSS/<%p.viewName%>.css
rm -f $cssPath 
touch $cssPath 
echo '<!-- %customCSSInsert% -->' >> $cssPath 

echo var:customCSSInsert:%customCSSInsert%
c95aec12-2d3a-4da5-96fd-3cda069bce22.template:
• Components
  • FAQ
  • Contact

Programmatically build web servers

Introducing /builder: A general purpose, personal, server configuration manager built with Node.js. Allows you to easily build and deploy web services and applications (webpage/etc) on any Linux cloud or private server. /builder is currently in development phase.



/builder is open source and is available on Github. https://github.com/sbgh/builder

Full software stack management

/builder allows you to be creative by stacking components. A component is a modular container of code, images, build/test scripts and other assets. /builder links the components together and deploys onto your server automatically.

Each component has the information to build its self.
One possible stack configuration


Drag and drop functionality on to your server to expand its capabilities.


Drill down to individual design components.


Add new abilities to your server by dropping them in

Drag and drop components into a new context. Edit the component variables then click build. Headless Chrome is used to display the web app being rebuilt.

Create a new phone input in the /contact app from a copy of email input then rebuild ui.

Modal title

Far far away...

3ea55362-2695-489a-8de6-e42e4432ab31.name: re/start node
3ea55362-2695-489a-8de6-e42e4432ab31.description:
Calls sudo forever start to start the node process.

added to crontab manually:
 sudo crontab -u ec2-user -e
@reboot /home/ec2-user/projects/HelloWorld/restartServer.sh
3ea55362-2695-489a-8de6-e42e4432ab31.script:
cd <%a.projectPath%> 

<%s.npmInstall%> forever -g

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serverName%' <%a.nodeFileName%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%projectPath%' <%a.projectPath%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

chmod 770 <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
nohup ./restartServer.sh > restart.log &

a18c0dd9-4e05-4813-b46a-d3a81dca7dfc.name: assets
a18c0dd9-4e05-4813-b46a-d3a81dca7dfc.script:
rm -f <%s.staticPath%>/assets.tar.gz
saveFile:assets.tar.gz:<%s.staticPath%>
<%s.waitFor%> <%s.staticPath%>/assets.tar.gz

saveFile:builderSetup.sh:<%s.staticPath%>

#strip out windows line feeds

mv -f <%s.staticPath%>/builderSetup.sh.tmp <%s.staticPath%>/builderSetup.sh

tar -zxvf assets.tar.gz

rm -f <%s.staticPath%>/assets.tar.gz

d039c2f0-bb54-48ff-89e9-f28d1c119ed9.name: sessions
d039c2f0-bb54-48ff-89e9-f28d1c119ed9.script:
cd <%a.projectPath%> 
pwd
<%s.npmInstall%> express-session
<%s.npmInstall%> session-file-store
<%s.npmInstall%> password-hash

#Generate pw hash and create identity json
rm -f <%s.projectPath%>/identity/identity.json
rm -f ./setIdentity.js
mkdir <%s.projectPath%>/identity
saveTemplate:3:<%s.projectPath%>/setIdentity.js
<%s.waitFor%> <%s.projectPath%>/setIdentity.js
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%password%' '<%c.password%>' <%s.projectPath%>/setIdentity.js
node ./setIdentity.js
rm -r ./setIdentity.js

export serverPathFile="<%p.serverPathFile%>"
export toReplace="//<add_Requires>"
export newline="var session = require('express-session');\nvar FileStore = require('session-file-store')(session);\n//<add_Requires>"

<%s.Replace file str with str%> "$toReplace" "$newline" "$serverPathFile" 

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/temp.txt
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/temp.txt
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/temp.txt
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%secret%' '<%c.secret%>' <%a.projectPath%>/temp.txt

ls
export toReplace='<add_app.use>'
<%s.Replace file line with file%> $toReplace temp.txt "$serverPathFile"
rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/temp.txt

0c2de9b1-139a-4c18-865c-7700f43605c5.name: CM Data Store Get (/cmGet)
0c2de9b1-139a-4c18-865c-7700f43605c5.description:
Provides a simple service to get jason data from a data store.
Returns a row or all rows. 
Call service with 'id=#' to get all rows. Call with 'id=[id]' to get a specific row.
Eg: 
http://myNode/ezGet&id=#
   This will return all rows
http://myNode/ezGet&id=123
  This will return only row where id=123

#insert updated template into server file

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

4de29be3-c73e-4267-a48a-355beca2d124.name: sudo re/start Server.js
4de29be3-c73e-4267-a48a-355beca2d124.description:
Installs and calls sudo forever start to start node process.

added to crontab manually:
 sudo crontab -u SysStackUser -e
@reboot /home/SysStackUser/projects/proto/restartServer.sh
4de29be3-c73e-4267-a48a-355beca2d124.script:
cd <%s.projectPath%> 

<%s.npmInstall%> forever -g

rm -f <%s.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
saveTemplate:<%s.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
<%s.waitFor%> <%s.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serverName%' <%c.serverFileName%> <%s.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%projectPath%' <%s.projectPath%> <%s.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

chmod 770 <%s.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
rm -f nohup.out
nohup ./restartServer.sh > restart.log &

0835029e-a4bb-4daa-af12-91c2133a05b0.name: FM Data Store Get (/fmGet)
0835029e-a4bb-4daa-af12-91c2133a05b0.description:
Provides a simple service to get jason data from a data store.
Returns a row or all rows. 
Call service with 'id=#' to get all rows. Call with 'id=[id]' to get a specific row.
Eg: 
http://myNode/ezGet&id=#
   This will return all rows
http://myNode/ezGet&id=123
  This will return only row where id=123
0835029e-a4bb-4daa-af12-91c2133a05b0.script:
rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

#insert jsonVar
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%jsonVar%' <%p.dataStoreVar%> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

#insert service End Point name
<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serviceEndPointName%' <%c.serviceEndPointName%>  <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt
echo var:ezDataGetServiceEndPointName:<%c.serviceEndPointName%>

#add currentHtmlInsert point to end of template
echo -e '\n<!-- <%a.insertServices%>  -->' >> <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt 

#insert updated template into server file
<%s.Replace file line with file%> '<%a.insertServices%>' <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt <%a.serverPathFile%> 

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/myTemp.txt

fa1e744b-e0f3-4714-bdfc-5b1548c3042e.name: re/start node
fa1e744b-e0f3-4714-bdfc-5b1548c3042e.description:
Calls sudo forever start to start the node process.

added to crontab manually:
 sudo crontab -u ec2-user -e
@reboot /home/ec2-user/projects/HelloWorld/restartServer.sh
fa1e744b-e0f3-4714-bdfc-5b1548c3042e.script:
cd <%a.projectPath%> 

<%s.npmInstall%> forever -g

rm -f <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
saveTemplate:<%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
<%s.waitFor%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%serverName%' <%a.nodeFileName%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

<%s.Replace file str with str%> '%projectPath%' <%a.projectPath%> <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh

chmod 770 <%a.projectPath%>/restartServer.sh
nohup ./restartServer.sh > restart.log &
